text: ratatouille is a classic French stew
made using summer vegetables and it's
actually very simple to make this
version also includes chicken breasts
that cook right in the pan with the
ratatouille start with your eggplant
you'll want one inch pieces they shrink
quite a bit and they soak up all of
those other flavors like a sponge and
what I especially love about this recipe
is that it's one pot so you should have
about six cups of eggplant once you've
cut it up and then a medium zucchini
it's about half-inch pieces so again
trim the ends and cut planks lengthwise
this just makes breaking down the
vegetable a little bit faster we're
about ready to get cooking I have four
bone-in skin-on chicken breast halves
that I've cut in half crosswise and this
will be enough to feed four to six
people have a large straight sided
skillet preheating over a medium-high
flame very important here and you start
with a quarter cup of extra virgin olive
oil give that a swirl in the pan the oil
should shimmer before you add anything
to it and that will tell you that the
oil is nice and hot because we do want
the eggplant to Brown a little bit in
this skillet
caryl oil is shimmering so that tells me
it's hot and in goes the eggplant and
give it a good toss so that it evenly
coats in the oil and season it right
away with salt and pepper two teaspoons
of coarse salt and pepper about a
quarter teaspoon freshly ground and
since we are on a medium-high flame
you'll want to stir this frequently
while the eggplant is doing its thing we
can season our chicken generously with
salt and freshly ground pepper and a
little more oil it really does take all
of this oil I assure you so don't skip
out on this part a drizzle this will
help the skin to crisp up in the oven
let's take a peek here
hey we're starting to get some color
this is already smelling terrific the
eggplants turning golden brown in places
and we can carry on now with the
zucchini and garlic I have two
tablespoons that's about six cloves that
have been minced get those in and this
we just need to cook until the garlic is
fragrant that happens very quickly
thirty seconds to one minute at most
okay the garlic smell is wafting up so a
pint of cherry tomatoes hole right into
the pan and 5 sprigs of thyme I always
like to rub herbs like this between my
hands for just a moment to release the
oils and the chicken you can just nestle
the chicken in evenly in a single layer
on top of the veggies this goes into a
preheated 450 degree oven for 25 to 30
minutes until the chicken registers 165
degrees on a thermometer and then turn
your oven to broil and let it boil for
one to two minutes until the chicken is
golden brown and crispy on top this easy
ratatouille is absolutely delicious
served with a crusty bread like a
baguette happy eating
